definition: debased, a support or foundation, to use as a basis for
details:
adjective
- debased
- illegitimate
= synonyms: baseborn
- having or showing an ignoble lack of honor or morality
= example: having or showing an ignoble lack of honor or morality
= synonyms: mean
- of low birth or station (`base' is archaic in this sense)
= example: of low birth or station (`base' is archaic in this sense)
= synonyms: baseborn, humble, lowly
- serving as or forming a base
= example: serving as or forming a base
= synonyms: basal
- not adhering to ethical or moral principles
= example: not adhering to ethical or moral principles
= synonyms: immoral
- (used of metals) consisting of or alloyed with inferior metal
= example: (used of metals) consisting of or alloyed with inferior metal
noun
- a support or foundation
= example: a support or foundation
= synonyms: stand
- a place that the runner must touch before scoring
= synonyms: bag
- (electronics) the part of a transistor that separates the emitter from the collector
- installation from which a military force initiates operations
= example: installation from which a military force initiates operations
= synonyms: base of operations
- a flat bottom on which something is intended to sit
= example: a flat bottom on which something is intended to sit
- the principal ingredient of a mixture
= example: the principal ingredient of a mixture
- lowest support of a structure
= example: lowest support of a structure
= synonyms: foundation
- the stock of basic facilities and capital equipment needed for the functioning of a country or area
= example: the stock of basic facilities and capital equipment needed for the functioning of a country or area
= synonyms: infrastructure
- the fundamental assumptions from which something is begun or developed or calculated or explained
= synonyms: foundation
- (linguistics) the form of a word after all affixes are removed
= synonyms: stem
- a lower limit
= synonyms: floor
- the place where you are stationed and from which missions start and end
= synonyms: home
- (anatomy) the part of an organ nearest its point of attachment
= example: (anatomy) the part of an organ nearest its point of attachment
- the bottom or lowest part
= example: the bottom or lowest part
- (numeration system) the positive integer that is equivalent to one in the next higher counting place
= synonyms: radix
- the most important or necessary part of something
= synonyms: basis
- the bottom side of a geometric figure from which the altitude can be constructed
= example: the bottom side of a geometric figure from which the altitude can be constructed
- any of various water-soluble compounds capable of turning litmus blue and reacting with an acid to form a salt and water
= example: any of various water-soluble compounds capable of turning litmus blue and reacting with an acid to form a salt and water
= synonyms: alkali
- a phosphoric ester of a nucleoside
= synonyms: nucleotide
verb
- to use as a basis for
= example: to use as a basis for
= synonyms: found, ground, establish
- to use purified cocaine by burning it and inhaling the fumes
= example: to use purified cocaine by burning it and inhaling the fumes
= synonyms: free-base
- to situate as a center of operations
= example: to situate as a center of operations
